definitions.definition: A magazine, normally produced by amateurs, intended for people who share a common interest
A small, rounded, transparent, and domestic aquarium.
(by extension) Any place or event that lacks privacy or is intensely scrutinized.
A variety of discussions where participants are organized in concentric circles and take turns where they and others in the same group are allowed to speak according to a set of rules.
The central and smallest circle where the speakers are located in some versions of such a discussion.
A gradual disappearance.
Of, related to or located in the deeper part of the sea
(sport fishing) of or related to open sea
definitions.example: deep-sea fishing

definitions.definition: (of a port) able to accommodate the largest ships.
A diploid individual that has equal alleles at one or more genetic loci.
A severe, disabling headache, usually affecting only one side of the head, and often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia and visual disturbances.
definitions.example: After consuming too much coffee every day for six weeks, she got severe migraines that would last up until 47 minutes after her first cup of coffee.

definitions.definition: A neurological condition characterised by such headaches.
The wife of a person in the armed forces killed in a war (and sometimes in other military action).
(by extension) A woman whose spouse has been killed in any conflict.
Any of the single-celled or multicellular organisms of the taxonomic domain Eukaryota, whose cells contain at least one distinct nucleus.
Something that accrues; advantage accruing
To increase, to rise
To reach or come to by way of increase; to arise or spring up because of growth or result, especially as the produce of money lent.
To be incurred as a result of the passage of time.
definitions.example: The monthly financial statements show all the actual but only some of the accrued expenses.

definitions.definition: To accumulate
definitions.example: He has accrued nine sick days.

definitions.definition: To become an enforceable and permanent right.
(Egyptian mythology) A being's soul or personality, represented as a bird-headed figure, which survives after death but must be sustained with offerings of food.
Father, baba.
A medieval football game played in parts of Scotland around Christmas and New Year.
To add color to.
definitions.example: The child colorized the drawing.

definitions.definition: To convert black and white media to color by digital post production (as is often done in digital photography and in video special effects).
definitions.example: There is a colorized version of Casablanca.

definitions.definition: The act of concealing oneself and lying in wait to attack by surprise.
An attack launched from a concealed position.
The troops posted in a concealed place, for attacking by surprise; those who lie in wait.
To station in ambush with a view to surprise an enemy.
To attack by ambush; to waylay.
A large dance or jazz band of 10 to 30 musicians usually featuring improvised solos by lead players, but otherwise playing orchestrated music.
The music produced by a jazz big band.
The fruit of the hazel tree.
Any of numerous small, mouselike, chiefly nocturnal, mammals of the family Soricidae (order Soricomorpha).
Certain other small mammals that resemble true shrews (order Soricomorpha).
An ill-tempered, nagging woman: a scold.
To beshrew; to curse.
A place where stars, planets and other celestial bodies are observed, usually through a telescope; also place for observing meteorological or other natural phenomena.
A lookout (vantage point with a view of the surrounding area)
An individual of more than one race.
Composed of, or having a mixture of, multiple races.
Tending to use obscene or offensive language
A flexible enclosing or separating tissue forming a plane or film and separating two environments (usually in a plant or animal).
A mechanical, thin, flat flexible part that can deform or vibrate when excited by an external force.
A flexible or semi-flexible covering or waterproofing whose primary function is to exclude water.
One who is learning.
definitions.example: She’s still a learner, so she’s prone to making mistakes.

definitions.definition: Direct payment by cash, as opposed to through a bank.
definitions.example: This cash in hand will come in handy as spending money on my trip to Asia.

definitions.definition: Unbanked, undeposited monies.
Receiving wages or salary directly in the form of cash, often without deducting tax.
definitions.example: Many high school students get cash in hand jobs for extra pocket money.

definitions.definition: In a manner receiving direct payment by cash, often without paying tax.
definitions.example: I heard he's working at that restaurant cash in hand to pay the bills.

definitions.definition: Alternative spelling of taekwondo
A swinging couch or bed, usually made of netting or canvas about six feet wide, suspended by clews or cords at the ends.
(obsolete outside dialectal) A piece of land thickly wooded, and usually covered with bushes and vines.
To lie in a hammock.
(of a cloth) To hang in a way that resembles a hammock.
To make something be wrapped tight, like in a hammock.
An inorganic compound
Relating to a compound that does not contain carbon
That does not originate in a living organism
A breakfast made of tomatoes, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, bacon, sausages, hash browns, baked beans, black pudding, chips, toast and mushrooms (or any combination thereof); full English breakfast
A small, rich, pastry or quick bread, sometimes baked on a griddle.
(Utah) Frybread served with honey butter spread on it.
The head.
To hit on the head.
definitions.example: 2004 December 3, "Sconed by a space rock - and then the headaches started", The Sydney Morning Herald

definitions.definition: A line from which a player takes a free throw
One of the two lines on the edge of a field marking the area inside which a fair ball may be hit.
A line between the lane and the approach, which the bowler must not cross.
In long jump, a line before which the jumper must start their jump with no part of the foot touching the line.
An infant born prematurely
Occurring before a state of readiness or maturity has arrived
definitions.example: a premature birth

definitions.definition: Taking place earlier than anticipated, prepared for, or desired
Suffering from premature ejaculation
A state of being flustered; overwrought confusion.
To make hot and rosy, as with drinking.
(by extension) To confuse; befuddle; throw into panic by making overwrought with confusion.
definitions.example: He seemed to get flustered when speaking in front of too many people.

definitions.definition: To be in a heat or bustle; to be agitated and confused.
To restore to ease, comfort, or tranquility; relieve; calm; quiet; refresh.
To allay; assuage; mitigate; soften.
To smooth over; render less obnoxious.
To calm or placate someone or some situation.
To ease or relieve pain or suffering.
To temporise by assent, concession, flattery, or cajolery.
To bring comfort or relief.
To keep in good humour; wheedle; cajole; flatter.
To prove true; verify; confirm as true.
To confirm the statements of; maintain the truthfulness of (a person); bear out.
To assent to; yield to; humour by agreement or concession.
A member of a criminal or street gang.
A member of a professional criminal organization; a racketeer.
To act like a gangster; to commit street crime or run a racket.
Of or pertaining to humanism.
(grammar) A morpheme added at the end of a word to modify the word's meaning.
definitions.example: The suffix "-able" changes "sing" into "singable".

definitions.definition: A subscript.
A final segment of a string of characters.
definitions.example: The string "abra" is both a prefix and a suffix of the string "abracadabra".

definitions.definition: To append (something) to the end of something else.
A young female horse.
A young attractive female.
definitions.example: Hey, Homer, get a load of the gams on that filly!

definitions.definition: A protective table mat, usually heat-resistant, for a single setting of plates and dishes.
An often childish display or fit of bad temper.
definitions.example: Baby Shawn threw a tantrum when he was told the bicycle was not his.

definitions.definition: To throw a tantrum.
Any fuel that is obtained from a renewable biological resource, especially from biomass
Semicoma.
Somnolence marked by periods of partial consciousness.
Ginkgo biloba.
Short, coarse hair, especially on a man’s face.
The short stalks left in a field after crops have been harvested.
The male monarch or ruler of an empire.
Any monarch ruling an empire, irrespective of gender, with "empress" contrasting to mean when consort to emperor
(political theory) Specifically, the ruler of the Holy Roman Empire; the world-monarch.
definitions.example: The Investiture Controversy was a conflict between the Emperor and the Pope.

definitions.definition: The fourth trump or major arcana card of the tarot deck.
A large, relatively valuable marble in children's games.
Any fish of the family Lethrinidae.
Any various butterflies of the subfamily Charaxinae.
Flexible and graceful in movement; lithe.
(except Scotland) A civil court which deals with civil cases, such as divorce.
A court which handles both civil and criminal cases.
(specifically, Victoria) An intermediate court; a district court.
The state or quality of being admissible or allowable.
A cereal of the species Hordeum vulgare, or its grains, often used as food or to make beer and other malted drinks.
Seed of Job's tears (Coix lacryma-jobi)
To destroy (especially, a large number of people or things); to obliterate.
To physically erase something written.
To do away with; to cause to disappear
To crash, fall over (especially in board sports such as surfing, skateboarding etc.)
A pale pink wine made by removing the dark grape skins at the required point during fermentation.
(foods) A meringue dessert usually topped with fruit and cream.
A branching and bony structure on the head of deer, moose and elk, normally in pairs. They are grown and shed each year. (Compare with horn, which is generally not shed.)
definitions.example: While hiking in the woods, I found an antler from a deer.

definitions.definition: A figure or shape showing rays radiating from a central point.
A strong outburst of sunlight.
Egg-laying; depositing eggs that develop and hatch outside the body as a reproductive strategy.
definitions.example: The echidna is a monotreme, which is the extremely small subset of oviparous mammals.

definitions.definition: The belief that the Universe is in some sense divine and should be revered. Pantheism identifies the universe with God but denies any personality or transcendence of such a God.
The belief in all gods; omnitheism.
A card much like a credit card, but which takes money directly from the bank account, rather than borrowing the money from the issuer of the card.
A simple monosaccharide (sugar) with a molecular formula of C6H12O6; it is a principle source of energy for cellular metabolism.
A savory dish made from cooked macaroni and cheese sauce; a cheesed macaroni dish.
Any of many polyps, of the order Actiniaria, which occurs in marine and estuarine habitats, and which captures its food using tentacles
An electromechanical or electronic bell, klaxon, chime, horn, speaker, strobe light or other device which warns people in a building of a possible fire or other condition requiring evacuation.
The sound or other warning made by a fire alarm.
An emergency response to a fire by the fire department with manpower and equipment.
definitions.example: A four fire-alarm fire ripped through a row of 2.5 story frame dwellings during the early morning hours

definitions.definition: To survive solely by consuming a certain thing.
definitions.example: When he was in the rainforest, he lived on bugs and rainwater.

definitions.definition: To endure.
definitions.example: Her memory lives on in our hearts.

definitions.definition: (usually transitive, sometimes intransitive, stative) To have a strong affection for (someone or something).
definitions.example: I love my spouse.   I love you!

definitions.definition: To need, thrive on.
definitions.example: Mold loves moist, dark places.

definitions.definition: To be strongly inclined towards something; an emphatic form of like.
definitions.example: I love walking barefoot on wet grass;  I'd love to join the team;  I love what you've done with your hair

definitions.definition: (usually transitive, sometimes intransitive) To care deeply about, to be dedicated to (someone or something).
To derive delight from a fact or situation.
definitions.example: I love the fact that the coffee shop now offers fat-free chai latte.

definitions.definition: To have sex with (perhaps from make love).
definitions.example: I wish I could love her all night long.

definitions.definition: To praise; commend.
To praise as of value; prize; set a price on.
The action of the verb to love.
Expressing a large amount of love to other people; affectionate.
definitions.example: his loving wife

definitions.definition: A legume resembling a nut, the fruit of the plant Arachis hypogaea.
A very small clam.
To pull on somebody's tie as a prank, causing the knot to tighten.
The policy, of a nation, of expanding its territory or its economic influence.
(grammar) A word that modifies a verb, adjective, other adverbs, or various other types of words, phrases, or clauses.
definitions.example: I often went outside hiking during my stay in Japan.

definitions.definition: To make into or become an adverb.
Pertaining to the kidneys.
A male agony aunt.
Slowed or weakened, as by drink, sleepiness, etc.
definitions.example: The medicine made him groggy and irritable.

definitions.definition: Of a horse: bearing wholly on its heels when trotting.
The act of banishing.
definitions.example: The judge pronounced banishment upon the war criminal.

definitions.definition: The state of being banished, exile.
definitions.example: He has been in banishment from his home country for well over four years.

definitions.definition: An explosive mixture of nitroglycerine and nitrate absorbed onto a base of wood pulp.
A dessert made by boiling gelatine, sugar and some flavouring (often derived from fruit) and allowing it to set, known as "jello" in North America.
A clear or translucent fruit preserve, made from fruit juice and set using either naturally occurring, or added, pectin. Known as "jam" in Commonwealth English.
A savoury substance, derived from meat, that has the same texture as the dessert.
Any substance or object having the consistency of jelly.
definitions.example: calf's-foot jelly

definitions.definition: A jellyfish.
A pretty girl; a girlfriend.
A large backside, especially a woman's.
A jelly shoe.
Blood.
To wiggle like jelly.
To make jelly.
A coconut with soft or gelatinous meat inside as well as the meat itself (which is of regular quality if the coconut is immature)
Jealous.
A genre of folk music and dance native to Andalusia, in Spain.
A song or dance performed in such a style.
To dance flamenco.
Any small piece of ice used for cooling drinks, larger than crushed ice, regardless of their shape.
definitions.example: The new freezer in our kitchen makes round ice cubes!

definitions.definition: To be concerned (about), to have an interest (in); to feel concern (about).
definitions.example: "She doesn't care what you think." "I don't care, I'm still going."

definitions.definition: (polite) To want, to desire; to like; to be inclined towards.
definitions.example: I don't care to hear your opinion.

definitions.definition: (with for) To look after or look out for.
definitions.example: He cared for his mother while she was sick.

definitions.definition: To mind; to object.
The act of one who cares.
(of a person) Kind, sensitive, empathetic.
definitions.example: She's a very caring person; she always has a kind word for everyone.

definitions.definition: A blog on which one posts brief, frequent updates on one's activities
To post on a microblog.
definitions.example: I started microblogging last week.

definitions.definition: The element with atomic number 92 and symbol U: a radioactive silvery-grey metal in the actinide series.
A singer, particularly a professional singer who performs ballads.
To sing a ballad
The seventeenth letter of many Semitic alphabets/abjads (Phoenician, Aramaic, Hebrew פ, Syriac ܦ, and others; Arabic has the analog faa).
The remains of something that has been cut off; especially the remains of a tree, the remains of a limb.
The place or occasion at which a campaign takes place; the husting.
A place or occasion at which a person harangues or otherwise addresses a group in a manner suggesting political oration.
One of three small wooden posts which together with the bails make the wicket and that the fielding team attempt to hit with the ball.
(drawing) An artists’ drawing tool made of rolled paper used to smudge or blend marks made with charcoal, Conté crayon, pencil or other drawing media.
A wooden or concrete pole used to support a house.
A leg.
definitions.example: to stir one's stumps

definitions.definition: A pin in a tumbler lock which forms an obstruction to throwing the bolt except when the gates of the tumblers are properly arranged, as by the key.
A pin or projection in a lock to form a guide for a movable piece.
To stop, confuse, or puzzle.
To baffle; to make unable to find an answer to a question or problem.
definitions.example: This last question has me stumped.

definitions.definition: To campaign.
definitions.example: He’s been stumping for that reform for months.

definitions.definition: To travel over (a state, a district, etc.) giving speeches for electioneering purposes.
(of a wicket keeper) To get a batsman out stumped.
To bowl down the stumps of (a wicket).
To walk heavily or clumsily, plod, trudge.
To reduce to a stump; to truncate or cut off a part of.
To strike unexpectedly; to stub, as the toe against something fixed.
A pleasant smell or odour.
To apply a fragrance to; to perfume.
The act of mobilizing
The marshalling of troops and national resources in preparation for war.
The process by which the armed forces of a nation are brought to a state of readiness for a conflict.
The softening of rock such that geochemical migration can take place
The transport of a copy of a gene from one chromosome, or one organism to another
A dish made from small pieces of meat or fish grilled on a skewer and served with a spicy peanut sauce, originating from Indonesia and Malaysia.
